parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To prevent, debar, hinder; with infin: from doing so and so. From the base of kolazo; to estop, i.e. Prevent.
To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.
To have in full, be far, it is enough. From apo and echo; to have out, i.e. Receive in full; to keep away, i.e. Be distant.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural

str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Participation, sharing in, receiving. From metalambano; participation.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
